unnormalised: Basically, neurology deals with the nervous system - the brain, spinal cord, and nerves. Think of it like the electrical wiring of your body. When something goes wrong with that wiring, neurologists like Dr. Rajesh Kumar at AIIMS, New Delhi, step in to figure out what's happening. Common problems they treat are things like strokes, epilepsy (you know, seizures), and multiple sclerosis (MS). Diagnosis often involves tests like EEG to measure brain activity or an MRI scan costing around Rs. 8000 at a private clinic.
normalised: Basically, neurology deals with the nervous system - the brain, spinal cord, and nerves. Think of it like the electrical wiring of your body. When something goes wrong with that wiring, neurologists like Doctor Rajesh Kumar at A-I-I-M-S, New Delhi, step in to figure out what's happening. Common problems they treat are things like strokes, epilepsy (you know, seizures), and multiple sclerosis (M-S). Diagnosis often involves tests like E-E-G to measure brain activity or an M-R-I scan costing around rupees eight thousand at a private clinic.

unnormalised: Treatments can vary a lot depending on the condition. For some patients, medication is enough, like taking 10mg of Diazepam daily for a specific period. For others, it might involve physiotherapy or even surgery. It's really important to see a qualified neurologist for an accurate diagnosis and treatment plan, especially if you're experiencing persistent headaches, dizziness, or numbness. Ignoring these symptoms can lead to serious problems down the line. Don’t just self-diagnose based on webMD!

unnormalised: And remember, it's not always about finding a cure; sometimes, it's about managing the symptoms and improving the quality of life. My neighbor, Mrs. Sharma, has Parkinson's disease, and she attends regular check-ups with her neurologist at Fortis Hospital, Bangalore. With proper care and support, she's able to lead a relatively normal life. So, if you think you might have a neurological problem, don't hesitate to consult a doctor!
